positive_comments: The Deliberately Developmental Company Culture Workbook was a good handout.  It was concise yet contained some valuable information.
improvement_opportunities: This module was very video heavy.  The lectures were lengthy to maintain adult learner attention.  They bogged down with the abundance of information on each leader.  The facilitator's points were sometimes lost in the long biographies of the leaders he mentioned.  Perhaps breaking up the lectures into shorter chunks, and adding more interactive elements, would make the module more engaging.  Also, there was a bad link in Module 2, Section 13.  I have attached a screenshot of the error.

positive_comments: Innovation Workbook and the Tough Conversations handouts were both excellent.  The deeper dive resources were also very valuable.
improvement_opportunities: The lectures were too long for adult learner attention spans.  At almost 30 minutes, they had information overload and would be better in smaller chunks.  The information contained in them was great, just too much at once to remain engaged.

positive_comments: The video text is effectively informative.
improvement_opportunities: Video 1 P 6, 1st statement. The word "impact" at the end should be "impactful". Video 2 P2. The phrase "AI empowers leaders" appears multiple times across the modules. Once was sufficient. Shorten to "AI can identify..." Make similar ellisions throughout the document. In general there are a substantial lack of examples. Each video segment must include examples. What without how is poor teaching.
show_stopper_details: The module suffers from the lack of examples

positive_comments: The video text is effectively informative.
improvement_opportunities: V1 P2 Alignment: change "AI companies" to "companies utilizing AI". (This module is much better than chap 1)
